Online gaming firms have been contesting the payment of 28% GST instead of 18% for the period up to October 1, 2023. The companies argue that the 28% tax rate applies only from October 1, whereas the government contends that the October 1 revision merely clarified a law already in force. The government's stance is that the demand for tax dues is not retrospective in nature.
In August 2023, the GST Council amended the law to state that all online games involving bets, regardless of skill or chance, would attract a 28% GST on the full value of the bets placed, starting October 1.
Following this decision, online gaming companies have faced significant tax demands, which experts warn could potentially devastate the industry.
Also Read: FIIs begin 2025 with $2 billion selloff in 7 days. 6 reasons driving the exodus
Delta Corp technical indicators Technically, the stock's relative strength index (RSI) is at 46.7. According to Trendlyne, an RSI below 30 is considered oversold, while above 70 indicates overbought conditions. Additionally, the MACD is at -1.8, which is below its signal and center line, this is a strong bearish indicator.
The stock above its 5-day, 10-day, 20-day, 30-day, and 50-day simple moving averages (SMAs), while trading below 100-day, 150-day, and 200-day SMAs.
Delta Corp shares performance Delta Corp shares have declined 19% over the past six months and 58% over the last three years. The company’s market capitalization currently stands at Rs 3,167 crore.
(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of the Economic Times)
